books.title: The Sea Hawk
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: A Cornish gentleman becomes a Barbary corsair and seeks vengeance on the jealous half brother who betrayed him.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: Wonderful Adventures of Mrs. Seacole in Many Lands
books.author: Mary Seacole
books.summary: A British Creole woman provides medical assistance during the Crimean War after her travels around Panama.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Emily of New Moon
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A budding poetess and orphan goes to live with her estranged aunts.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: The Seagull
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A has-been actress, her ambitious playwright son, a male writer, and an aspiring young actress struggle to realize their romantic and artistic aims.

books.title: Lud-in-the-Mist
books.author: Hope Mirrlees
books.summary: After more than two hundred years of stability, a sudden surge in contraband fairy fruit threatens the peace and mental heath of citizens in the borderland town of Lud-in-the-Mist.

books.title: The Duel
books.author: Aleksandr Kuprin
books.summary: A Russian officer battles disillusionment and unrequited love.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: Lost Man’s Lane
books.author: Anna Katharine Green
books.summary: A citizen detective investigates mysterious disappearances in an isolated village.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.

books.title: The Theory of Moral Sentiments
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith assesses the sources of human morality and the role of human sympathies in judging the propriety of our actions and behaviors.

books.title: A Cycle of the West
books.author: John G. Neihardt
books.summary: A series of epic poems that recounts the history, legends, and mythology of the American West.

books.title: The Coming of Bill
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A domineering author of books on eugenics and hygiene makes a match between her niece and an idle artist, intending them to raise a son according to her principles, regardless of the consequences.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: A collection of short stories by H. G. Wells in a variety of genres ordered by date of publication.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: The City of God
books.author: Augustine of Hippo
books.summary: Bishop Augustine of Hippo provides a defense of the Christian faith against its pagan critics, as well as explaining God’s work and purposes in world history, from beginning to end.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
